title: The week in tennis: Zverev wins in Paris, and the ATP Finals spots are locked in
description: With Djokovic out, the last three ATP Finals spots have been determined, while Zverev had a big victory in France this week.
author: D'Arcy Maine

title: Tyler, the Creator name-drops Coco Gauff in new album
description: The tennis star was mentioned in the rapper's seventh studio album.
author: Kalan Hooks

title: 13 Ways to DESTROY Your Tennis Competition (Legally) - Essential Tennis Podcast #413
description: If you love tennis and want to perform your best in competition so you can win many more matches than ever before, then this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast is exactly for you. You're about to learn the top 13 ways that you can instantly improve your competitive results through highly practical and actionable tips and tricks related to strategy, mindset, technique, and the mental game. Let’s start winning more tennis matches NOW!
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: The Best Tennis Players Do These 3 Things - Essential Tennis Podcast #412
description: If you want to be a great tennis player then you MUST do the three things revealed in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, PERIOD. The best players on your local courts do them and the weakest ones don’t, so don’t miss any of these insights because they’ll level up your game fast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: Norrie completes Van Assche revenge job in Metz
description: Payback was sweet for Cameron Norrie on Wednesday at the Moselle Open. The Briton overcame #NextGenATP home favourite Luca Van Assche 6-3, 3-6, 6-1 to book his quarter-final spot at the indoor hard-court ATP 250. Seeking to avenge a three-set loss to Van Assche on the ATP Challenger Tour last month, Norrie delivered an emphatic third-set display to seal a one-hour, 52-minute victory in Metz. “Luca and I played a couple of weeks ago in Roanne in a Challenger and he got me last time, so it was nice to face him again and have the chance to get revenge,” said Norrie. “I have a lot of respect for him. He’s so tough to play and I had to really serve well and come up with some really good stuff, especially in the third set, to get a break. Then I managed to hold my nerve and serve it out, but a lot of credit to Luca to come out and compete the way he did.” Lightning fast reactions ⚡️⚡️@cam_norrie pulls through a tight encounter against Van Assche 6-3 3-6 6-1 to make the final 8 in Metz!@MoselleOpen | #MoselleOpen pic.twitter.com/hmfFQ7gE6v— ATP Tour (@atptour) November 6, 2024 Norrie converted three of six break points he earned against Van Assche, according to Infosys ATP Stats. The former No. 8 in the PIF ATP Rankings, who is this week competing as the World No. 57 after an injury-disrupted 2024, will next take on Zizou Bergs, who eased past Hugo Gaston 6-4, 7-5. “I’m just trying to play point for point, and really just enjoy competing in the last week of the year for me,” said Norrie, who will contest his first ATP Tour quarter-final since April in Barcelona. “It’s a good week so far. I just want to take it match by match and stick around in Metz another day. I want to keep going and I’m definitely going to have to keep improving my level to have any chance of going further at the tournament.” Despite Van Assche’s loss, there was plenty for the home fans to cheer on Wednesday in Metz. Quentin Halys kicked off the day by prevailing 6-1, 4-6, 6-4 in an all-French clash against Pierre-Hugues Herbert, while Benjamin Bonzi later upset second seed Casper Ruud 6-4, 6-4. Bonzi won 85 per cent (33/39) of points behind his first serve in his maiden Lexus ATP Head2Head clash with World No. 7 Ruud. It was the biggest win of the 28-year-old’s career, and he will next take on Halys in his first tour-level quarter-final since February 2023. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Watch Turin draw live: Will Alcaraz land in Sinner's group?
description: Fans will be able to watch live as the elite eight players at the Nitto ATP Finals are placed into their four-man groups in Turin on Thursday. A live stream of the draw will be available on nittoatpfinals.com at approximately 12:45 p.m. CET/6:45 a.m. ET. Top seed Jannik Sinner heads the Ilie Nastase group and could find himself matching up with archrival Carlos Alcaraz, who comes into the tournament as World No. 3. New World No. 2 and two-time tournament champion Alexander Zverev heads the John Newcombe group, where he could face 2020 champion Daniil Medvedev. Alcaraz and Medvedev will be randomly drawn into either the Nastase or Newcombe groups. World No. 6 Taylor Fritz and No. 7 Casper Ruud will also find themselves in opposing groups, as will No. 8 Alex de Minaur and No. 9 Andrey Rublev. (World No. 6 Novak Djokovic has withdrawn from the event due to injury.) The doubles field will be split into the Mike Bryan Group and the Bob Bryan Group. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Zheng breezes into WTA Finals last four as Rybakina stuns Sabalenka
description: Zheng Qinwen crushes Jasmine Paolini to reach the WTA Finals last four as the already-qualified Aryna Sabalenka loses to Elena Rybakina.

title: Norrie aims to end season on a high after reaching Moselle quarter-finals
description: Britain's Cameron Norrie beats Luca van Assche at the Moselle Open to reach his first ATP Tour quarter-final since April.

title: Wilson RF 01 Playtest and Review
description: In this review, I explore the RF 01, a racket designed by Roger Federer to bring elements of his game to a broader audience. Wilson says it’s the line of rackets Federer would have used if he had successfully recovered from knee surgery in 2021. Sadly, we all know that never happened, so we can’t …
author: Martina

title: Zverev Humbles Humbert with Paris Masters Victory
description: Alexander Zverev silenced the French crowd on Sunday, producing a clinical performance to defeat Ugo Humbert 6-2 6-2. Humbert was bidding to become the first homegrown Paris Masters winner since Jo-Wilfried Tsonga in 2008, but he never got close. Even though he likes to fist pump after winning the most trivial of points, he struggled …
author: Jonathan
